title: (x) The Penn Gazette text face - Eidetic Neo {Marc O}
content:
Hi,  
Can anyone ID this specimen used as the type for the [Penn Gazette](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.upenn.edu/gazette)? I really love the lowercase “a” and “m” and the italic “z”.

Thanks,  
Josh

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [PennGazetteSample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/typophile.com/files/PennGazetteSample.jpg) | 30.45 KB |

 [‹ (x) wood type straight-sided grotesque - H&FJ Knockout {Yves, Ben}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17273 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Dalmore Scotch logo? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17279 "Go to next forum topic")
author: joshcarr

comments.content:
Eidetic Neo, from Emigre (originally from PsyOps)  
 [http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=91](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=91 "http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=91")
Wow, super quick response. Thanks alot, marcox. I thought it had an Emigre feel to it...

You can also license directly from [PSY/OPS](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eideticneo.html). One of the benefits is that you have the option of picking up Eidetic Neo and [Eidetic Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eidetm.html) (the corresponding sans) in a bundle for 15% off the standalone price.

PSY/OPS also offers other cool stuff like a free weight for every $100 spent, a 15% student discount, and the option to try out a single weight and then deduct its cost from that of the whole family if you decide to purchase a family license within 30 days.

Word. I already picked up two weights of [Armchair Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eideticneo.html) with my home licenses of [Sophisto](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_sophisto_ss.html) and [Oxtail](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_oxtail.html), and the corporate-wide licenses for Sophisto and [Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eideticneo.html) made [my employer](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.magelaan.be/) pick up the other weights of Armchair Modern and the frankly surprising and very exciting [Hydrous](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_hydrous.html).

The complimentary free licenses allow you to try out stuff you maybe wouldn’t think of. Plus — I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again — [Psy/Ops](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235736/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/psy_ops) has one of the most consistent and forward-thinking compact collections on the market. Classy on the outside, quirky on the inside. Melts in yo’ brain, not in your eyes. You can’t go wrong, really.
